titleStmt.title: Henry Palm v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Henry Palm v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District, Washington Territory, holding terms at Olympia for the Counties of Thurston, Mason, Lewis and Chehalis.
In the matter of the application of Henry Palm for a writ of Habeas Corpus } Petition for Writ
To the Honorable Roger S. Greene, Judge of said Court.

The petition of Henry Palm respectfully shows, that he the said Henry Palm is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined, and restrained of his liberty by William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County; at the County jail in Thurston County Washington Territory:
That said imprisonment, detention, confinement and restraint are illegal and that the illegality thereof consists in this towit -

That on or about the 13th day of April 1878 your petitioner was arrested in the town of Olympia in said County and Territory, upon a warrant sworn out by one I.V. Morsman, charging him with the crime of murder, committed in the town of Olympia in the year 1874. That on the 19th and 20th days of April 1878 a preliminary hearing was had before one A.R. Elder, a committing magistrate in and for said town of Olympia and for said County, and at the close of said hearing your petitioner was committed by said Elder to answer the said charge, before the next Grand Jury in and for said County.

Your petitioner that nothing in the evidence adduced before such magistrate justified such commitment. Nothing having been shown tending to criminate your petitioner in the slightest degree. That your petitioner is an innocent man, and is not guilty of the crime charged. That the next Grand Jury will not meet until December next, some eight months from this time, and that your petitioner will, unless your Honor grant his petition, be wrongfully incarcerated for that length of time to his great detriment both of body and mind. That your petitioner asks that he may have a hearing before your Honor and that your Honor will review the known testimony upon which he was committed.

Wherefore your Petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted, directed to the said William Billings, Sheriff as aforesaid, commanding him to have the body of your Petitioner before your Honor, at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your Honor con- cerning your Petitioner, together with the time and cause of his detention and said writ, And your Petitioner may be restored to his liberty.
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss
Henry Palm being duly sworn says: That he is the petitioner named in the fore- going petition. That he has heard read the said petition, and knows the contents thereof and that the same is true.
Sworn to and subscribed to before me this 14th day of May 1878 H.H. Newlin Notary Public in and for Thurston County W.T.
Application of Henry Palm for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
